node.title: Eight million Australian homes aren't energy efficient. Many occupants are battling change
node.alt: A man puts up a foil against a window.
node.description: Eight million Australian homes contribute to 18 per cent of Australia's carbon emissions, a new report shows. Enacting any major change is especially hard for renters and people in low-income households.
node.content:
["Marley White is a big fan of environmental hacks on a budget.", "Along with his four\u00a0flatmates, Marley\u00a0has installed shade cloths, replaced 32 lightbulbs, and even salvaged bubble wrap to put up on windows.", "It's all part of their mission to reduce\u00a0carbon emissions and power bills.", "\"It saves me a lot of money to think about these things in the long run. It saves the environment,\" Marley says.", "But their rental home\u00a0in the Melbourne inner-west suburb of Footscray\u00a0was build decades ago, on a large block, and has none of the modern trimmings being put into new homes under current\u00a0energy efficiency standards.", "A new report released today suggests that 8 million Australian homes are in this situation.", "The report by PowerHousing \u2014\u00a0an organisation which helps Community Housing Providers (CHPs) develop and manage affordable housing across Australia \u2014\u00a0says those 8 million homes contribute between 18 and 20 per cent of Australia's carbon emissions.", "It says they are\u00a0\"often inefficient\" because they were built before current energy efficiency standards, and are overwhelmingly old builds on larger blocks that are close to commuter centres and public transport.", "\u201cIt sadly doesn't surprise me that so many homes are energy inefficient,\" Marley says.\u00a0", "\"There just hasn't been very good standards up until quite recently. And it's so expensive [to fix]\u00a0that in rental properties. It's not worth it to upgrade when the tenants are still going to be paying the same rent.\u201d", "", "
PowerHousing's Nicholas Proud wants many of Australia's homes to be knocked down and replaced with smaller homes that are more energy efficient.(ABC News: Nick Haggarty)
", "PowerHousing's chief executive, Nicholas Proud, says many of these homes should be \"knocked down and rebuilt\".", "He suggested doing this could see more homes replaced on smaller blocks, which would boost the amount of houses in the market and, potentially, bring down prices for potential buyers.", "\"We need to be looking to replace those homes,\" he says.", "\"We need to see more affordable options, more environmental options, we need to see greater opportunity for people to get their foot on the property ladder.", "\"Those people are paying the highest bills, proportionate to their wage, for the lowest type of conditions. And that's got to change.\"", "This suggestion comes as Australia battles through yet another property boom.", "
How are renters and low-income homes battling change now?
", "In Australia, about 40 per cent of a household's power consumption goes towards heating and cooling.", "Many older builds struggle to keep consistent temperatures, due to a lack of proper insulation, glazed windows and draught-proofing.", "", "
Marley White installed this secondhand $5 shade cloth at his rental property to reduce cooling bills over summer.(ABC News: Dylan Anderson)
", "Self-confessed bargain-hunter Marley White\u00a0is tackling\u00a0his rental property's\u00a0insulation issues by a series of affordable life hacks.", "Some of those\u00a0measures\u00a0include a\u00a0shade cloth to block the summer\u00a0sun that he found online for $5, a door stopper for draughts also bought for a steal, and the salvaged foil bubble wrap that's put up on windows as a replacement to double glazing.", "His flatmates are also into the low-carbon lifestyle.", "", "
Melbourne flatmates Marley White, Anna Morris\u00a0and Benjamin Dawborn are trying to\u00a0reduce energy consumption at their rental property.(ABC News: Dylan Anderson)
", "Anna Morris and her husband use a device that turns off appliances, such as their computer and musical equipment, when they're done with using them.", "\"We save a little bit of power using that,\" Anna says.", "The four-bedroom household also just used a Victorian government program to replace all 32 lights in their home for free with LED bulbs.", "That measure alone saw their power bills go down by 10 per cent.", "\"It's good to see that instant result,\" she says.", "", "
Anna Morris and her flatmates reduced power bills by 10 per cent by switching to LED globes.(ABC News: Dylan Anderson)
", "However, this is all\u00a0just the tip of what the household would like to do to cut down their emissions.", "
What else would this\u00a0share house like to do?
", "The share house is connected to both gas and electricity for its appliances. They use as much of the electricity as possible for cooling, including air-conditioning, but cannot\u00a0disconnect the gas altogether.", "\"We'd prefer not to use gas. It's burning fossil fuels and it's an extra connection cost,\" Marley says.", "\"But, being a rental, it's not an option we have.\"", "", "
Marley White would like to switch off the gas but can't because they're renters.(ABC News: Dylan Anderson)
", "He would also love to switch to solar energy \u2014\u00a0but that would involve the landlord hooking up panels and the inevitable issue of who would pay for the $10,000-plus connection.", "\"Solar panels on the roof would be great \u2014\u00a0there's so much sun around these days,\" he says.", "", "
RMIT's Nicola Willand says renters can install cheap measures such as draught-proofing to cut down bills.(ABC News: Billy Draper)
", "There are 2.6 million rental homes in Australia.", "RMIT University energy efficiency researcher Nicola\u00a0Willand says the Footscray share house is doing all the right things to reduce its emissions within the\u00a0limitations.", "She is\u00a0interested in the impacts of energy inefficiency on low-income and rental homes.", "\"Studies have found that renters tend to live in homes that are less insulated, and have less efficient appliances, than owner-occupied homes. So there is a disadvantage already,\" she says.", "\"As an owner, you have the agency to do whatever you like to your house. So you can really go mad and make very, very energy efficient changes.", "\"Renters don't have that agency. They need the landlord's permission.\"", "
At the other end of the spectrum
", "As millions of households are held back from efficiency, other households are improving their homes through both small and big measures.", "Rowan White and Sue Nash have lived in their 1880s terrace home in Melbourne's inner suburb Fitzroy North for decades.", "", "
Sue Nash and Rowan White put solar panels on their Melbourne terrace home\u00a0in 2016.(ABC News: Emilia Terzon)
", "\"We used to be so cold in winter \u2014\u00a0we froze,\" he says.", "Sue owns the property, so the couple has been able to embark on an energy-reduction journey together.", "There were no ad-hoc measures involving second-hand bubble wrap \u2014\u00a0as homeowners they could put in proper insulation, double-glaze the windows, install heat pump hydronic heating, and renovate their floor plan to maximise light.", "In 2016, the couple\u00a0also installed solar panels for $13,500. That means they can power their house during the day with renewable technology.", "\"That's paid us back about five grand [until] now, and it'll pay us back [entirely] in another five years,\" Rowan says.", "", "
Rowan White and Sue Nash put solar panels on their Melbourne terrace in 2016.(ABC News: Emilia Terzon)
", "They also switched off their gas connection and hooked up all electric appliances.", "\"We have the privilege of money to afford to buy some of the equipment to try things, and to be a bit experimental and risk things going wrong,\" Rowan\u00a0adds.", "However, the couple aren't rolling in cash. Some measures, including their appliances, were done on a budget, too.", "\"We got a bottom-of-the-range induction cook top,\" Rowan says.", "\"It's fantastic. It works for us. I make jam with it. I do it in the middle of the day, in the middle of summer, so the jam is pure solar.\"", "", "
Rowan White makes his jam on his electric induction stovetop during the day in summer using\u00a0solar power.(ABC News: Emilia Terzon)
", "Aside from 'Rowie's solar jam', their renewable energy connection is also helping to power a new toy: A\u00a0second-hand electric car bought this year for $26,600.", "\"It's done 30,000 kilometres in Japan and I imported it through a company in Tasmania that's doing that in bulk,\" he says.", "Rowan works as a driving instructor, so the payback for it should be less than many households, who are still weighing-up the financial benefits of EVs and home battery storage.", "\"I have some students who are school strike leaders,\" he says.", "From all these measure, the couple's\u00a0power bills have dropped from $896 annually\u00a0in 2014 to $571 this year.", "", "
Rowan White bought this electric car on the secondhand market.(ABC News: Emilia Terzon)
", "\"I'm absolutely delighted with the house and the renovation,\" Sue\u00a0says.", "\"I'm enjoying all the benefits that I get from a more comfortable house and a more environmentally sound house.\"", "The couple has\u00a0also found community in a social media group called My Electric Home, where they share tips and learnings.", "
There's an economic case for upgrades
", "Dr\u00a0Willand\u00a0says many other Australian homes can be fitted out in the same way\u00a0to improve energy efficiency.", "\"I'm German,\u00a0so I'm used to central heating and warm homes,\" Dr\u00a0Willand says.\u00a0", "\"I always find it interesting how Australians think\u00a0living in a cold home is normal. And they don't realize that there's actual health risk attached to that. But I find Australians can be really resourceful as well.\"", "\"So that may be an argument [renters]\u00a0could put forward or that you'll stay longer in the property, because it makes it more attractive for you as well, as a renter, and landlords like that.\"", "Many state governments have incentives for landlords to improve properties.", "This week, the Victorian government announced a $1,000 rebate for landlords to install more energy efficient heaters.\u00a0", "Energy efficiency consultant Rachel Brdanovic says\u00a0other measures people can\u00a0do in rental homes \u2014 or where people are on a budget \u2014 include installing devices that monitor energy usage.", "This is something the Footscray share house has already done.", "\"In Victoria, the PowerPal is free under a government program but there are lots of options for no more than a few hundred dollars,\" Ms Brdanovic\u00a0says.\u00a0", "\"Once you understand which are the largest energy consuming appliances, you can look at how to use them less or upgrade to more efficient versions.\"", "She says renters can also switch to certified renewable energy providers if available on their network.", "\"However, by taking individual action, we can reduce our own costs, improve our comfort and encourage others to do the same.\""]
